info.name: Bookker API REST
info.description:
This is the documentation of the Bookker API REST and contains all collections and definitions currently available in this service.

This API facilitates systems integration with Bookker services as it is intended to provide a programatic interface for clients and resources manager providers for a standard and automatic access to Bookker services.

The API contains the following collections:

1. **Authentication:** definition of the call to obtain access tokens for authorized API calls.
    
2. **Reports:** a set of calls to manage the process of obtaining booking information for an Organization.
    
3. **Resources:** a set of calls to obtain of the resources of the client's Organization.
    
4. **Users:** a set of calls to request information of the users of the client's Organization.
    
5. **Bookings:** a set of calls to perform check-in and check-out on a given bokking

item.name: Auth

request.description: This call provides a valid token for communication with Bookker API REST

response.name: OK

item.description:
**The API** uses [**OAuth Authorization**](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749)

1. You can view your API credentials in your **Bookker administrative website** > **Panel Website Settings** > **API Credentials**.
2. You can use your API credentials to obtain a `TOKEN`, using the `get token` request.
3. You can use this `TOKEN` to access API resources by passing it in the `Authorization` header: `Authorization: TOKEN` .
4. All API requests must be made over HTTPS.

query.description: requiered - maximum 90 days in the past

request.description:
this request allows the client to request all past bookings in the history of the client's Organization with `end date` in the period specified as a range of dates (`from` and `to`).

The following are a set of default limitations in the range of dates of this request:

- This request can query of 3 months in the past, ie. initial date (`from`) cannot be sooner than 3 months
- The initial date (`from`) is always sooner or equal to the that final date (`to`)
- The final date (`to`) is always sooner to today, ie. 'to' parameter must be before the current date
- Date format is `dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss` in UTC

response.name: OK

item.description:
This request allows the client to request all past bookings in the history of the client's Organization in a given `period`. The maximum time to request in the history are 90 days. Possible vaules of the parameter `period` are: | period | Description | | --- | --- | | **yesterday** | to request all bookings in the history with `end date` from yesterday at UTC 00:00:00Z to today at at UTC 00:00:00Z | | **last7days** | to request all bookings in the history with `end date` from 7 days at UTC 00:00:00Z to today at at UTC 00:00:00Z | | **last15days** | to request all bookings in the history with `end date` from 15 days at UTC 00:00:00Z to today at at UTC 00:00:00Z | | **last30days
** | to request all bookings in the history with `end date` from 30 days at UTC 00:00:00Z to today at at UTC 00:00:00Z | | **period** | to request all bookings in the history with `end date` in a given period of time specified in the querystring by the `from` and `to` parameters |

item.name: futurebookings

query.description: requiered - maximum 30 days in the future

request.description:
this request allows the client to request all active bookings in the client's Organization with `end date` in the period specified as a range of dates (`from` and `to`).

The following are a set of default limitations in the range of dates of this request:

- This request can query of 1 month into the future, ie. initial date (`to`) cannot be later than 1 month
- The initial date (`from`)is always sooner or equal to the that final date (`to`)
- The initial date (`from`) is always later to today, ie. 'from' parameter must be after the current date
- Date format is `dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss` in UTC

response.name: OK
No OK
response.body:
{
  "uniqueId": "ex sunt",
  "timestamp": "2020-05-18T09:05:41.534Z",
  "status": 1768042,
  "errors": [

  ],
  "type": "exercitation",
  "path": "dolor nulla",
  "message": "aute ad tem"
}

item.description:
This request allows the client to request all bookings that are active for the future in the client's Organization in a given `period`. The maximum time to request in the future are 30 days.

Possible vaules of the parameter `period` are:

| period | Description |
| --- | --- |
| **period** | to request all bookings in the history with `end date` in a given period of time specified in the querystring by the `from` and `to` parameters |

This collection allows the client to request bookings of the client's Organization. Bookings can be of two types:

- **Past bookings:** these ones belong to historic data, in the sense that that users utilized them in the past. This bookings have and `end date` older than the current time.
    
- **Future bookings:** these ones are active, in the sense that that users are going to utilize them in the future. This bookings have and `end date` greater than the current time.
    

Every request should include the following headers:

| Header | Description |
| --- | --- |
| **Authorization** | Auth Token to authorize communications |
| **x-api-key** | Client code to access Organization data within a given service plan |

### Pagination

The API endpoints returning multiple objects (lists) support  
pagination. These lists share a common structure and requests can take at least  
these two parameters:

| Parameter | Description |
| --- | --- |
| **page** | a.k.a. **page offset** - the number of pages to skip. _Optional, default: 0 (i.e. return the first page of results)_ |
| **size** | a limit on the number of objects to be returned. Between 1 and 500. _Optional, default: 500_ |

List response format:

```
{
    items: [
        { ... },
        { ... },
        { ... }
    ]
}

 ```

### Errors

The API uses conventional HTTP response codes to indicate the success or failure of an API request.

In general:

- Codes in the **2xx** range indicate success.
    
- Codes in the **4xx** range indicate an error that failed given the information provided (e.g., a required parameter was omitted, a resource was missing, etc.).
    
- Codes in the **5xx** range indicate a serer error or an unprocessable entry
    

Every error include a human-readable message:

```
{
    "uniqueId": string,
    "timestamp": "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.xxxZ",
    "status": integer ($int32),
    "errors": [list of strings],
    "type": string,
    "path": string,
    "message": string
}

 ```

item.name: Resources
Building
Parking
Get fixed Parking slots in a building

query.description: optional - possible values true/false. If the parameter is not set all resources are retrieved

request.description:
this request allows the client to request all active bookings in the client's Organization with `end date` in the period specified as a range of dates (`from` and `to`).

The following are a set of default limitations in the range of dates of this request:

- This request can query of 1 month into the future, ie. initial date (`to`) cannot be later than 1 month
- The initial date (`from`)is always sooner or equal to the that final date (`to`)
- The initial date (`from`) is always later to today, ie. 'from' parameter must be after the current date
- Date format is `dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss` in UTC

item.description:
This package has one api call (_Get the buildings of an organization_) that returns the request all buildings activated in an organization.

The call has the following parameters:

| **Parameters** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| withBuildingHolidayCalendar | optional - to request additional information of the building regarding its holidays calendar. Possible values can be `true` or `false` and if the parameter is not set all information is retrieved |
| isVisible | optional - to filter the buildings retrieved. Possible values can be `true` or `false` and and if the parameter is not set all information is retrieved. Buildings not visible can not be used in bookings |

This package has one api call (_Get the year calendar of blocking in a building_) that returns the calendars that block reservations in a building.

The call has the following parameters:

| **Parameter** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| **year** | Requiered. This parameter specifies the `year` of the calendars retrieved |

The package can also retrive information of fixed resources in the organization. In particular there are two folders to do this:

- **Parking:** in this folder the api calls retrive information about the fixed resources of the cathegory Parking in a building and the periods released of these resources (Cessions)
    
- **Workstation:** in this folder the api calls retrive information about the fixed resources of the cathegory Workstation in a building and the periods released of these resources (Cessions)
    

The api calls that retrive information of the Cessions can be parametrized for a specific period of time. These calls retrive the Cessions in a period specified with the parameters `from` and `to`.The maximum time to request in the past is 90 days and in the future 30 days.

Possible vaules of the parameters are:

| Parameters | Description |
| --- | --- |
| **from** | requiered - to request cession with `end date` after a given date specified in the querystring by the `from` parameter (maximun 90 days in the past) |
| **to** | requiered - to request cession with `end date` before a given date specified in the querystring by the `to` parameter (maximum 30 days in the future) |

item.description:
This package has one api call (_Get floors in a building_) that returns the request all activated floors in an building.

The call has the following parameters:

| **Parameters** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| type | optional - to filter the floors retrieved. Possible values can be `OFFICE` or `PARKING` and if the parameter is not set all types are retrieved |
| visible | optional - to filter the floors retrieved. Possible values can be `true` or `false` and and if the parameter is not set all information is retrieved. Floors not visible can not be used in bookings |

item.description:
This package provides information of resources, rules of use of these resources and calendars associated with their use.

It also has another api call (_Get the resources of a building_) that returns the resources in a building. The buildings can be filtered using different parameters.

The call has the following parameters:

| **Parameter** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| **category** | optional - possible values WORKSTATION/SPACE/PARKING/DINING_AREA. If the parameter is not set all categories are retrieved |
| **maxCostPerHour** | optional - filter to specify resources with a given max value. If the parameter is not set all resources are retrieved |
| **floorId** | optional - filter to specify resources with a given floor. If the parameter is not set all resources are retrieved |
| **groupId** | optional - filter to specify resources with a given group. If the parameter is not set all resources are retrieved |
| **isSynchronized** | optional - filter to specify resources that are synchronized with Microsoft. If the parameter is not set all resources are retrieved |
| **isVisible** | optional - to filter the resources retrieved. Possible values can be `true` or `false` and and if the parameter is not set all information is retrieved. Floors not visible can not be used in bookings |

This package has a folder **Rule** with an api call to retrive the rule of a resource (_Get the rule of a resource_)

This collection allows the client to request information of the resources of the client's Organization. Resources information covers the following packages:

- **Building:** these api calls return information of the buildings in an organization and information about the fixed resources in a building.
    
- **Floor:** these api calls return information of the floors of a building
    
- **Resources:** these api calls provide information of resources, rules of use of these resources and calendars associated with their use.
    

Every request should include the following headers:

| Header | Description |
| --- | --- |
| **Authorization** | Auth Token to authorize communications |
| **x-api-key** | Client code to access Organization data within a given service plan |

### Pagination

The API endpoints returning multiple objects (lists) support  
pagination. These lists share a common structure and requests can take at least  
these two parameters:

| Parameter | Description |
| --- | --- |
| **page** | a.k.a. **page offset** - the number of pages to skip. _Optional, default: 0 (i.e. return the first page of results)_ |
| **size** | a limit on the number of objects to be returned. Between 1 and 500. _Optional, default: 500_ |

List response format:

```
{
    items: [
        { ... },
        { ... },
        { ... }
    ]
}

 ```

### Errors

The API uses conventional HTTP response codes to indicate the success or failure of an API request.

In general:

- Codes in the **2xx** range indicate success.
    
- Codes in the **4xx** range indicate an error that failed given the information provided (e.g., a required parameter was omitted, a resource was missing, etc.).
    
- Codes in the **5xx** range indicate a serer error or an unprocessable entry
    

Every error include a human-readable message:

```
{
    "uniqueId": string,
    "timestamp": "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.xxxZ",
    "status": integer ($int32),
    "errors": [list of strings],
    "type": string,
    "path": string,
    "message": string
}

 ```

item.description:
This collection allows the client to request information of the users of the client's Organization (user's data and status). Resources information covers the following packages:

- **Despartments:** these api calls return information of the departments in an organization.
    

Every request should include the following headers:

| Header | Description |
| --- | --- |
| **Authorization** | Auth Token to authorize communications |
| **x-api-key** | Client code to access Organization data within a given service plan |

### Pagination

The API endpoints returning multiple objects (lists) support  
pagination. These lists share a common structure and requests can take at least  
these two parameters:

| Parameter | Description |
| --- | --- |
| **page** | a.k.a. **page offset** - the number of pages to skip. _Optional, default: 0 (i.e. return the first page of results)_ |
| **size** | a limit on the number of objects to be returned. Between 1 and 500. _Optional, default: 500_ |

List response format:

```
{
    items: [
        { ... },
        { ... },
        { ... }
    ]
}

 ```

### Errors

The API uses conventional HTTP response codes to indicate the success or failure of an API request.

In general:

- Codes in the **2xx** range indicate success.
    
- Codes in the **4xx** range indicate an error that failed given the information provided (e.g., a required parameter was omitted, a resource was missing, etc.).
    
- Codes in the **5xx** range indicate a serer error or an unprocessable entry
    

Every error include a human-readable message:

```
{
    "uniqueId": string,
    "timestamp": "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.xxxZ",
    "status": integer ($int32),
    "errors": [list of strings],
    "type": string,
    "path": string,
    "message": string
}

 ```

Users' information covers one package:

- **Departments:** these api calls return information of the departments of the organization
    

It also has a set of api calls to retrieve the users and the information associated to them in the organization:

- **Get user data**: to retrieve the information of a user given his/her id
    
- **Get users in an organization**: to retrieve the users in an organization
    

| Parameters | Description |
| --- | --- |
| **status** | optional- to request users with `status` ACTIVATED/LOCKED. If not parameter is set all users are retrieved. |

- **Get states of work of a user**: to retrieve the states of work of a given user. Possible vaules of the parameters are:
    

| Parameters | Description |
| --- | --- |
| **from** | requiered - to request cession with `end date` after a given date specified in the querystring by the `from` parameter (maximun 90 days in the past) |
| **to** | requiered - to request cession with `end date` before a given date specified in the querystring by the `to` parameter (maximum 30 days in the future) |

- **Get user's extra fields**: to retrieve extra information of a given user
